result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham Vazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 3 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Defendant to Register as a Sex Offender for life. Defendant to comply with any Sex Offender treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint or her residence. Comply with AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Maintain absolute sobriet, comply with random urine screens. Comply with any rules deemed appropriate by agent. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abraham Vazquez

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 9/7/17 from Public Defender's Office, advising they cannot appoint an attorney to appeal this case because defendant did not establish that he is financially eligible.
Transcript - Sentencing hearing 06-14-2017

Fax dated 7/10/17 received from the State of Wisconsin State Public Defender's Office, requesting a File stamped copy of the notice of intent. Faxed a copy of defendant's Notice of Intent to Pursue Post-Conviction Relief with a note advising a hard copy was mailed 6/30/17.
Letter to the State Public Defender's Office with Notice of Intent, Judgement of Conviction and List of Court Reports

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abraham Vazquez in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  State makes recommendations.  Nicole M appears and makes statements.  Lewis H appears and makes statements on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Govin makes statements to the Court.   Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:
18 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 3 days )  DEFENDANT REMANDED TO CUSTODY FORTHWITH
-	8 Years of Initial Confinement
-	10 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
	
No contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint or her residence.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Defendant to register as a sex offender for life.
Defendant to comply with any sex offender treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with any rules deemed appropriate by the agent.

Cost: $268.00 Apply cash bail previously posted, refund the balance to the poster. 

DNA surcharge: $250.00  Apply cash bail previously posted, refund the balance to the poster.

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Independent pre-sentence report dated 6/8/17 by Jacqueline Schmidt, Sentencing & Dispositional Consultant, with cover letter, filed by defense counsel Govin.
Letters in support of defendant, filed by defensen counsel Govin
Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
